text: the the first things to go are things
that are typically uh done in our own
operations the absolute last thing to go
is anything that touches the the
customers you need to be able to
especially in these times um add more
service to what your client's business
is all about and so what we do is we
look internal to the company how can we
save on travel how can we save on
unnecessary expenses around the office
how can we use more smartw workking if
you will rather than office space we're
going through a lot of that uh study and
research right now but it's always back
office first uh nothing to touch the
customers I have an example which of
course I won't use the the name of the
company um but there is a lot of things
that uh this company needed to do to be
more competive itive it's a it's very
difficult right now not only is the
economy very low but um competitors are
coming from out of the woodwork to try
to go and and get customers and so what
this one client of mine did was they
scaled back on sales resources and
marketing resources and really the folks
that position your products out into the
marketplace and it severely handicapped
them yes they saved on their sgna
expenses but absolutely lost clients
because another comp competitor came in
and gave them better service everybody's
in cost cutting mode and we're not uh uh
any different than that and so what we
do is we actually go to the employees
and we have what's called a A1 thousand
challenge where we try to get ideas from
the actual employees that are working in
the front office or the back office
working with clients or working in our
own operations to determine how can you
actually really uh cut cost without
cutting service to your clients so the
employees come up with a lot of ideas a
lot more than uh just executive sitting
in a room
sometimes
